content: waffle weave dishcloth this pattern makes a great in- expensive dishcloth or hotpad the textures from the front post double_crochet stitches make it nice for scrubbing your pots and pans and make it thick enough to use as a hotpad supplies 1 ball sugar n cream worsted cotton 70g 120yrds per ball j hook guage not important instructions foundation chain 32 note you can alternatively do 30 foundation double crochets if you do so skip row 1 row 1 double_crochet in 2nd stitch from the hook and continue to double_crochet across 30 stitches row 2 *double_crochet fpdc* across ending with a double_crochet in the turning chain turn chain 2 repeat row 2 until just short of desired length final row double_crochet in each stitch ending with a double_crochet in the turning chain cut yarn and fasten_off border join yarn to any double_crochet double_crochet around double_crochet 2ch double_crochet in corner stitch for each corner 8282828282828282828282828282 2828282828282828282828282828 8282828282828282828282828282 2222222222222222222222222222 000000000000000000000000000000 00 00 00 00 special stitches front post double_crochet fpdc yarn over pass hook from right to left under the front of the post of the next stitch yarn over and pull yarn under the post 3 loops on hook yarn over and pull through 2 loops yarn over and pull through remaining 2 loops slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet 8 front post double_crochet fpdc c victoria selnes 2008
